title.narrative: Enhancing Mobility Monitoring at the Thailand Myanmar Border

description.narrative: With no peaceful solution in sight, the situation in Myanmar is likely to continue to deteriorate resulting in heightened mobility and displacement within the country with cross border movement into neighboring countries, including Thailand. The ongoing COVID-19 pandemic further increases vulnerability of the affected populations while at the same time increasing the risk of seeding new clusters of COVID-19 in return and host communities. With the borders remaining closed, irregular crossings are likely to increase. Support to the Royal Thai Government will be needed to ensure that the safety, dignity, human rights and fundamental freedoms of Myanmar Migrants are respected at all times. This project will enable IOM to scale up ongoing mobility monitoring efforts, gather and share information on complex migration flows at the border. This includes information on Myanmar migrants crossing the border, apprehensions of irregular Myanmar migrants in Thailand, deportations / returns of Myanmar nationals to Myanmar, challenges faced by Myanmar migrants to remain in Thailand. This information will be used to inform preparedness and response activities and advocate for access and protection of this mobile group.
